I worry with the ongoing #RussiaUkraineConflict everyone will forget about #COVID19 

Yesterday in the prior 24 hrs there were 1,246,843 new confirmed cases & 6,702 new deaths - the highest in #Russia.

Infectious diseases can be exacerbated in areas of conflict & insecurity

I worry this will have a knock on affect to #Ukraine as the situation escalates. Given the low #COVID19 #Vaccine uptake in Ukraine along with potential for spread this could be devastating for the country and be too must stress for its healthcare system to handle.

This is exactly what I am getting at when I say that wars cause devastation and destruction - I fear people will not be thinking about #COVID19 with all going on, but as of yesterday #Russia had the highest number of cases (135,172) in 24 hours https://t.co/LaDJTKJHXL

@charlie_baker23 Agreed - they decided to lift #COVID19 restrictions on Wed and the next day it seemed as if a majority had abandoned the use of his important PHSM - its not like our COVID situation changed much from Wed to Thurs. 

In my opinion these measures should be lifted slowly

#COVID19 is not #endemic 

#endemic does not mean the end of the pandemic. There are plenty of diseases that are endemic that still cause high morbidity and mortality such as #malaria

I personally don't like the term "living with #COVID19"

I think a better way to describe it is "learning how to better manage #COVID19" especially since we have numerous interventions (#therapeutics, #vaccines, #PHSM) to decrease morbidity & mortality.

Two days after #Switzerland lifted their #COVID19 measures and how are things going? 

Yesterday there were 14,816 cases/100,000 people - I walked into a grocery store and was one of the few wearing a #mask. 

I understand people want the pandemic to be over, but it's not yet.

Seven weeks into 2022 and we have 10 human cases of #AvianInfluenza
